plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: Oleander is a hardy evergreen shrub or small tree that blooms profusely in warm climates, producing clusters of fragrant, funnel-shaped flowers.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, Southern United States, and tropical/subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Despite its beauty, all parts of the oleander plant are highly toxic if ingested, containing cardiac glycosides.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: The Christmas Rose is a perennial flowering plant that blooms in winter, even through snow in some regions, with white flowers often tinged with pink or purple.
plants.location: Alpine regions of Central and Southern Europe
plants.funFact: The Christmas Rose has been used in folk medicine despite its poisonous properties and is historically associated with the holiday season.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: A popular ornamental shrub or small tree known for its large, glossy leaves and showy, rose-like flowers that bloom in colder months.
plants.location: East Asia and cultivated worldwide in mild climates
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers are highly valued in East Asian cultures and are a symbol of admiration and perfection.

plants.name: Eucalyptus pauciflora
plants.description: A cold-tolerant eucalyptus species native to the Australian Alps, producing small, creamy white flowers that attract pollinators even in winter.
plants.bloomingSeason: Winter (June to August in Southern Hemisphere, i.e., December to February in Northern Hemisphere)
plants.funFact: Snow gums have adapted to survive harsh alpine climates, with smooth bark that changes color as it sheds.
